title: I wish Riot Games did something about the toxicity of this community.
body: I'm sick of playing games of people who just straight up flame for no reason and get away with it, no matter how many times you report them. Chat Banning them for 10-20 games isn't going to do anything to fix their behaviour, because they're still going to flame, no matter what. So Riot, I think you need to start being a stricter company with behavioural standards, cos your game is going to hell at the moment, especially in OCE.

Didn't they recently announce a new approach to player discipline for precisely this reason? It's a problem with no easy fix.

As Sekai mentioned quite aptly, it's a free-to-play game centred on competitive PvP and random matchmaking. The tribunal was a decent idea but turned out to be ultimately ineffective. It can't just be about punishment - especially in a FtP model, this does not work.

They need to give proper incentives to reward positive gameplay. If a player is always noted as being a great team member or very friendly rather than being reported by his opponents or allies, there should be a significant reward for that behaviour. IP boosts, random runes, or perhaps if someone gets an incredible amount of positive feedback from their fellow gamers, who knows - 10% off vouchers for 1 skin, free champions, fancy borders or other profile-oriented changes.... At the same time you increase the punishments for severe negative player feedback. Bans, strip them of any ranked accolades, or shame them with a very visible icon for other summoners to see.
